Covid and Shutdowns - House Floor Remarks This Morning:  I rise this morning in defense of Governor Gavin Newsom who recently defied his own idiotic Covid edicts as he partied at one of the few restaurants that he has not yet forced out of business... https://t.co/2d6BBh31r6
1/3 I rise this morning in defense of Governor Gavin Newsom who recently defied his own idiotic Covid edicts as he partied at one of the few restaurants that he has not yet forced out of business.

2/3  I defend him because he was doing what we all once did in a free society: make our own decisions over what risks we are willing to run and what precautions we are willing to take according to our own circumstances to protect our own health.
3/3 The governor SHOULD make his own decisions about running his own life.  I only ask that he and his ilk would stop telling the rest of us how to run ours.  Remarks: https://t.co/mZySJvw6Xq

2/2 This is vital to assuring the legitimacy of the result. This process must be completed before anyone declares a victor.

1/2 Votes are still being counted and there are serious allegations of illegal voting and illegal procedures that could affect the outcome of the presidential election. We have a well-established process to weigh the evidence of these allegations and resolve these disputes.
2/2 We should always be very much aware that every fraudulent vote steals the vote of a legitimate voter.  Statement from my interview yesterday on KAHI Radio.

1/2 I’m very concerned about election integrity. I remember the days when we all voted in person on election day. That’s why we called it ELECTION DAY. What they’ve done to our voting system is a travesty. It undermines confidence in the system and it opens the door to fraud.

5/5 These laws were passed with the promise they would improve the forests. After more than four decades I think we are entitled to ask how are the forests doing?  Read Congressman McClintock's full House Floor remarks here: https://t.co/9CcvDoOhJT

4/5 Really? These environmental laws generally apply only to public lands. Today you can easily tell the boundaries between private & public lands solely by the condition of the forests. How clever of the climate only to decimate the public lands.

3/5 We have been trying for years to reform these laws resume active forest management & restore our forests to health. Yet the environmental leftists have blocked us every year. Instead politicians use the excuse of climate change.

2/5 Draconian restrictions on logging grazing prescribed burns & herbicide use on public lands have made modern land management endlessly time consuming & ultimately cost prohibitive. A single tree thinning plan typically takes four years & more than 800 pages of analysis.

1/5 Last week President Trump came to CA to be briefed on the horrific fires raging in CA. Instead he got a lecture from Gov. Newsom & his staff on climate change. Beginning in the 1970s we imposed environmental laws that have made the management of our lands all but impossible.
Thank you for the support in fighting the #CreekFire https://t.co/vbO0x7l0C9

I'm humbled to represent former prisoners of war and I mourn those who didn't come home. Over 81900 Americans remain missing. They bought our liberty with their sacrifice. You are not forgotten. #POWMIARecognitionDay  https://t.co/IwDB8P30qD

If Gavin Newsom actually believes that if we were to all just ride our bikes to work and set our thermostats to 80 degrees then these wildfires will go away he is completely delusional… Interview via @Newsmax TV  https://t.co/XFrSlekpbA https://t.co/XXgunjHcWE

4/4 The mismanagement has gotten to the point where you can now tell the boundary between private lands that are not affected by these laws & the public lands that are.  Listen to Congressman McClintock discusses forest management on The John & Ken Show: https://t.co/lwvbP3YZJQ
3/4 We've had an 80% decline in timber harvested out of our federal forests since 1980 and we've had a concomitant increase in acreage destroyed by fire.
2/4 Then in the 1970s we began imposing environmental laws that have made it all but impossible to carry out that timber. What we've seen over those decades is increasingly severe forest fires.

1/4 Excess timber comes out of the forest in one of two ways it's either carried out or it burns out. We used to carry it out it was called logging. We had healthy forests and we had a thriving economy.

3/3 It is time for every American of good will to stand up against them and time for every elected official to declare which side of the rule of law they stand on.
2/3 They have made their position crystal clear: they hate our nation and all that our nation stands for and are prepared to impose their views on society by force.

1/3 Abraham Lincoln warned that “There is no grievance that is fit object for redress by mob law.” The leftist violence in our streets has nothing to do with protest or reform. It has everything to do with contempt for our democratic principles and republican institutions.

As I look at the wreckage on our streets it becomes clear that the ultimate target of the left is not isolated abuses by law enforcement officers but rather law enforcement itself.  As we can now see without law enforcement there is no law & without law there is no civilization.
